Package index

All functions

ellipse()
Ellipse constructor
ellipse_par_example
An ellipse parameter object example. Is a list with two elements. #' @format A list with two elements. One vector and one matrix:
mu

mu parameters of the ellipse

S

Covariance parameters of the ellipse

ellipse_points()
Ellipse points
get_A_matrix()
Calculates the inverse of covariance matrix from environmental variables
get_ENM_par()
get_ENM_par
get_density()
Environmental density from presence points
get_ellip_par()
Get ellipsoid parameters. A function to compute average and the inverse of covariance matrix from environmental data
get_env_var()
get_env_var Function to extract environmental values from presence points
get_example_data()
Function to return mammal shapefiles of Rodentia order
get_mahalanobis()
Mahalanobis distance
get_negative_log()
Get the negative log-likelihood value from quadratic forms of environmental information from presence points and a sample from an M hypothesis
get_negloglike_optim_par()
get_negloglike_optim_par Function to optime negloglike function given parameters from presence points and a sample of environmental points from a M hypothesis. Returns a list of
get_negloglike_optimr_par()
get_negloglike_optim_par Function to optime negloglike function given parameters from presence points and a sample of environmental points from a M hypothesis. Internally runs Returns a list of parameters
get_optim_par()
get_optim_par Get the parameters for the optimization of the Mahalanobis ellipse
get_suitability()
get_suitability Function that calculates the log(suitability)
negloglike_multivariable()
Negative log likelyhood
plot(<ellipse>)
Plot method for "ellipse" class
predict(<ellipse>)
Predict method for "ellipse" class
print(<ellipse>)
Print method for "ellipse" class
quad()
quad Function that calculates quadratic terms
rawSpOccPnts
Raw species ocurrence points from Abeillia abeillei presence points after download and clean from GBIF. This is a hummingbird example. A dataset with three variables. Contains scientific name, longitude and latitude #' @format A data frame with 73 rows and 3 variables:
species

Species name

long

Decimal longitide geographical cooordinate, in degrees

lat

Decimal latitude geographical cooordinate, in degrees

samMPts
Samples points from M hypothesis to estimate negative log likelihood from Abeillia abeillei presence points. This is a hummingbird example. A dataset with two variables containing points contains 2 bioclimatic variables #' @format A data frame with 10000 rows and 2 variables:
bio1WH

temperature, in C

bio12WH

precipitaion, in mm

samMPts_1_12_19
Samples points from M hypothesis to estimate negative log likelihood from Abeillia abeillei presence points. This is a hummingbird example. A dataset with two variables containing points contains 2 bioclimatic variables #' @format A data frame with 10000 rows and 2 variables:
bio1WH

Yemperature, in C

bio12WH

Precipitaion, in mm

bio19WH

Precipitation of Coldest Quarter, in mm

sam_polyM()
Sample environmental points from M hypothesis
spOccPnts
Species ocurrence points to estimate negative log likelihood from Abeillia abeillei presence points. This is a hummingbird example. A dataset with two variables containing points contains 2 bioclimatic variables #' @format A data frame with 73 rows and 2 variables:
bio1WH

temperature, in C

bio12WH

precipitaion, in mm

bio1WH
